column4: does anyone here know how I can delete all MS-DOS newlines from a file using a shell script? I know ^M is fine when you're in a console but I can't put ^M into a shell script
could tell you how to do it in vim.. not big on shell scripts tho;)
I'm hoping there's something line \n but for DOS newlines instead of UNIX ones
it's the same as vim.. ctrl+v then ctrl+m
